paragraphs.text: The fantasy of an Iran-US partnership.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: When
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: US Vice-President Joe Biden told an American university audience in October that Turkey, the UAE and Saudi Arabia are responsible for arming al- Nusra, ISIL, and other al-Qaeda-rooted extremists in Syria and that there is no "moderate middle" in the country
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: there was(as most non-Americans expected) little coverage of this stunning admission in the US mainstream media
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Indeed
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: what little coverage there was focused on Biden's subsequent apologies to Turkish, Emirati, and Saudi leaders for having made such comments in the first place
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Predictably, there was no follow-up reporting in the New York Times reminding Americans that the US is itself complicit in funding and arming extremists in Syria
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In early 2013, the newspaper reported what many in the region already knew
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: that since the beginning of 2012, the CIA had been deeply involved in procuring weapons for anti-Assad forces, airlifting arms to Jordanian and Turkish airports, and "vetting" rebel commanders- all to help US allies "support the lethal side of the civil war"
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: Other reports pointed out that these shipments were actually paid for by US allies, at the bidding of the Obama administration
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: But
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: after the Biden revelation, the so-called "newspaper of record" made no reference to how the US, in violation of international law, helped to facilitate the Syrian civil war- and, in the process, to enable the rise of ISIL
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Western-backed extremism is neither a new nor regionally-bound concept
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Whether it is the "Contra" rebels in Nicaragua or al-Qaeda-like groups in Afghanistan, the objective has always been to achieve strategic objectives through the infliction of mass suffering - for, in the "free and civilised world" of the US and its allies, the utopian end too often justifies the Mephistophelean means
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: More recently, an important footnote to the Libyan civil war was the involvement of Abdul Hakim Belhaj, previously the leader of the Libyan Islamic Fighting Group as well as an al-Qaeda member
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: He was one of many Libyan militants influenced by a takfiri (apostate) ideology
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: the groups with which he was affiliated were designated as terrorist organisations by the US State Department
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Nevertheless
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: he, along with other like-minded militants, became central components in the efforts of western and Arab-backed anti-Gaddafi forces to capture Tripoli, the Libyan capital
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Western willingness to cooperate with al-Qaeda (or "former" al-Qaeda) militants in Libya was a major turning point
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Even the subsequent death of the US ambassador to Libya did not change US policy in this regard
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Belhaj became the representative of Libya's interim president after Gaddafi's overthrow (before the complete ruin of the country)
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: More importantly, the willingness of the US and European and "Middle Eastern" allies to embrace al-Qaeda-like militants took US and western foreign policy in the region back to what it had been before the September 11, 2001 attacks - a policy of cooperation with violent extremists to undermine regional actors the West considers problematic
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Monster they created
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: This policy quickly expanded from Libya to Syria
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the repercussions are being felt today in countries like Pakistan, Nigeria, Australia, and China
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: After Gaddafi's overthrow, Turkey - a NATO member - allegedly helped Belhaj to meet with leaders of the so-called "Free Syrian Army" in Istanbul and along the Syrian-Turkish border
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In the meetings the former al-Qaeda leader discussed supporting the FSA with money, weapons, and fighters
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: at a time when the CIA was a major conduit for the transfer of weapons from Libya to Syria
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: While
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Belhaj was just one of many al-Qaeda affiliates involved in violent anti-government campaigns in both Libya and Syria
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: his openly acknowledged role underscores how the supposedly "moderate" FSA was, from early on in the Syrian civil war, as Iran repeatedly warned, deeply associated with and infiltrated by extremists
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Over time, the problem grew so large with ISIL's rise that it became impossible to hide the monster that the US and its allies had created
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: And so, Washington launched yet another chapter in its never-ending post-9/11 "war on terror"
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Notwithstanding Washington's professed determination to degrade and, ultimately, to destroy ISIL, Iran remains profoundly skeptical of US intentions
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Even after dramatic gains by ISIL in Iraq and the formation of a US-led coalition of the guilty to fight it, this coalition has, on average, carried out just nine airstrikes per day in both Iraq and Syria
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: In comparison, western reports indicate that, in the same period, the Syrian air force alone has at times carried out up to 200 strikes in 36 hours
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: Even as
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: these largely inconsequential US-led airstrikes are carried out in Iraq and Syria
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: some regional players continue to provide extensive logistical support to ISIL
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: along Syria's borders with Jordan and the Israeli regime, the Nusra Front continues to collaborate with other extremist militias backed by foreign (including western) powers
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In light of these realities, Iranians - who have been indispensable in preventing the fall of Damascus, Baghdad, Aleppo, and Erbil- simply do not buy the argument that a repentant US is now waging a real war against ISIL, the Nusra Front, and other extremist organisations in Iraq and Syria
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Rather, Iranians see the evidence as pointing to a complex (yet foolish) policy undertaken by Washington and its allies for the purpose of"containing" the Islamic Republic
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: What, then, would be the justification - under such circumstances and as Iranian allies are successfully pushing back extremists in Iraq and Syria
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: - for the Islamic Republic to cooperate with the US in Iraq?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: No matter how much some may try to tempt it
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Iran will not play Faust to America's Mephistopheles
paragraphs.label: assumption
